requestBody.description: Webhook is a user-defined callback, which can be maintained via API. CallFire will send POST request to a client's endpoint defined in webhook once one of assigned events is triggered. See [webhooks guide](https://developers.callfire.com/webhooks-guide.html) for more information about CallFire Webhooks API.

callback.description: URL that webhook will send POST to on resource event trigger

createdAt.description: A time when the given resource was created, formatted in unix time milliseconds (read only). Example: 1473781817000

enabled.description: A parameter which allows the webhook to send requests to unknown ssl endpoints (ssl certificate verification is disabled)

events.description: Comma separated list of events on resource that will trigger callbacks (ex: STARTED, STOPPED, FINISHED, etc...).

fields.description: A limit callback response to a particular fields

nonStrictSsl.description: A parameter which allows the webhook to send requests to unknown ssl endpoints (ssl certificate verification is disabled)

resource.description: A resource name that webhook is watching events on. Use GET /webhooks/resources to determine resources and events available (ex: InboundCall, OutboundCall, InboundText, OutboundText, CallBroadcast, TextBroadcast, etc...)

secret.description: Webhook secret token which is used as a signing key to HmacSHA1 hash of json payload which is returned in 'X-CallFire-Signature' header. This header can be used to verify callback POST is coming from CallFire. See [security guide](https://developers.callfire.com/security-guide.html)

singleUse.description: If true is set then webhook triggers only once. Afterwards the webhook will be deleted

updatedAt.description: A time when the given resource was updated, formatted in unix time milliseconds (read only). Example: 1473781817000
